title: binding/SkiaSharp.iOS project build fails with error MSB4044 in VS 2017 on Win10
body:
### Description

Trying to build SkiaSharp.iOS project fails with:

Error	MSB4044	The "BTouch" task was not given a value for the required parameter "BTouchToolPath".	SkiaSharp.iOS	C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2017\Professional\MSBuild\Xamarin\iOS\Xamarin.iOS.ObjCBinding.CSharp.targets	60	


### Code

1. follow the build direction for Windows and macOS.
2. on macOS, copy output/native/ios files to Windows
3. Launch binding\SkiaSharp.sln
4. Set "SkiaSharp.iOS" as the startup project: Debug, Any CPU
5. Set configuration manager to select only SkiaSharp.iOS

### Expected Behavior

No error in the build.
[I was able to build Desktop, Android and UWP projects without any error]

### Actual Behavior

Error MSB4044. [see details above]

### Basic Information

- Version with issue:  cloned yesterday Dec 11, 2018 [using git bash window].
- Last known good version:  ?
- IDE:  Visual Studio 2017, 15.9.3
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
 
  - iOS:  xamarinios1.0 [copied from .csproj file]

- Target Devices:
  -   N/A

### Screenshots

N/A

### Reproduction Link

[see steps above]
